meanings.definition: An improvement in the condition or strength of something.
meanings.sent1: The revival of the garden after the rain brought new life to the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The revival of the old building made it look brand new.
meanings.sent3: The revival of the tired puppy's energy was a joy to watch.
meanings.sent4: The revival of the city's economy was like a phoenix rising from the ashes.
meanings.sent5: The revival of the plant was a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing something back to life, attention, or use.
meanings.sent1: The revival of the ancient tradition brought the community together.
meanings.sent2: The revival of the old play delighted the audience.
meanings.sent3: The revival of the forgotten recipe sparked a culinary adventure.
meanings.sent4: The revival of the classic car was a labor of love for the owner.
meanings.sent5: The revival of the historic building preserved its legacy for future generations.

meanings.definition: A renewed interest or popularity in something.
meanings.sent1: The revival of vinyl records among young listeners surprised many.
meanings.sent2: The revival of the band's music brought back memories for fans.
meanings.sent3: The revival of the retro fashion trend made everyone feel nostalgic.
meanings.sent4: The revival of the TV show's viewership was unexpected but welcomed.
meanings.sent5: The revival of the once-forgotten artist's work captivated art enthusiasts.
